title: 110_hr5523
content: The "Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008" establishes a license fee on internet gambling operators and requires licensee information reporting. This Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose the fee. The Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008 requires licensed internet gambling operators to pay a 2% fee on all funds deposited into betting accounts each month. The fees collected are deposited into the Treasury's general fund as revenue. The Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008 mandates that licensed internet gambling operators pay a 2% fee on all deposited funds, which are then deposited into the Treasury's general fund as revenue. The fee is the exclusive obligation of the operator and cannot be deducted from bet amounts. The Director is defined as per section 5382 of title 31, United States Code, and the fee may be treated as an excise tax for administrative purposes. The Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008 requires licensed internet gambling operators to pay a 2% fee on deposited funds, treated as an excise tax for administrative purposes. Administrative provisions allow the fee to be treated as an excise tax. "SEC. 6039J. RETURNS OF INTERNET GAMBLING OPERATORS." Every Internet gambling operator subject to section 4491 must provide required information to the Secretary, including the operator's details and those of individuals placing wagers. Maintaining appropriate records is also mandatory as per regulations. Every Internet gambling operator must provide the IRS with detailed information about their operations, including the names, addresses, and tax information numbers of individuals placing wagers, along with their gross winnings, wagers, and losses. Additionally, operators must report tax withheld, account balances, and transaction details for each individual. Operators are also required to furnish a written statement to each person listed in the report. Every person required to make a return under subsection (a) must provide a written statement to each person listed in the report, including the name, address, and phone number of the information contact, along with the required information for the return. The statement must be given by January 31 of the following year. The table of sections for internet gambling operators is amended to include a new item. The amendments apply to wagers made after December 31, 2008. Additionally, there are provisions for withholding from certain gambling winnings. The amendments to the table of sections for internet gambling operators include provisions for withholding from certain gambling winnings, specifically net internet gambling winnings exceeding $5,000 in a calendar year. The new paragraph defines "proceeds of net Internet gambling winnings" as amounts withdrawn from an Internet gambling account, "net Internet gambling winnings" as gross winnings minus the amount wagered, and clarifies the meanings of "Internet" and "wager." The amendment defines net Internet gambling winnings as gross winnings minus the amount wagered, and clarifies terms related to Internet gambling. An Internet gambling operator is considered the payee, with terms defined in section 3402(q)(7). The amendment applies to wagers placed after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4. WITHHOLDING OF TAX ON NONRESIDENT ALIENS. (a) Tax on Nonresident Alien Individuals.--Section 871(a)(1) is amended to include a 30 percent tax on income not connected with United States business, other fixed income, and net Internet gambling income. (b) Exemption for Certain Gambling Winnings.--Section 871(j) is amended to exempt certain gambling winnings, including wagers placed over the Internet. (c) Withholding of Tax on Nonresident Alien Individuals.--Section 1441 is amended to include withholding tax on gains on transfers. The first sentence of subsection (b) of section 1441 is amended to include withholding tax on gains on transfers and proceeds of net Internet gambling winnings exceeding $5,000 in a calendar year. These amendments apply to wagers made with a licensee after December 31, 2008. SEC. 5. TAX ON WAGERS. Amends section 4401 to make persons placing wagers with unlicensed individuals liable for tax. Also amends section 4404 to specify territorial extent. Effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2008.
